text.p: -- J.P. Morgan analyst David Barden has raised his rating for international telephone operator PT Indonesian Satellite Corp, or Indosat, to buy from long-term buy.
-- "Key uncertainties surrounding the company's regulatory environment and settlement rate income have been resolved," Barden wrote in a Feb 24 report.
-- "A multiyear agreement to reduce the Indonesia-U.S. settlement rate by an average 20 percent per year will have a marginal impact on revenue but should provide for a more stable profit outlook.
-- "A recent resolution to World Trade Organization talks on telecommunications has left Indosat's duopoly intact, which again offers a stable platform for future growth."
-- The company's American Depositary Receipts were off 1/4 to 28-3/4 in New York.
